latest_week.brief_summary: OCaml 5.4.0 release preparation, new C thread registration API, and GC fixes merged
latest_week.new_features_summary: New C API for domain-specific thread registration and GC root handling fix
latest_week.new_features:
- New **C API function** `caml_c_thread_register_in_domain` enables registering C threads in specific domains rather than just domain 0, with accompanying `caml_find_index_of_running_domain` helper function for looking up domain indices by unique ID ([1f39a26](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1f39a263bb5bdee11c2ce75b702c4f9254d7c6fd), [f8de0cb](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/f8de0cbb7d7cbb34c69733f66f56e2b60bda4bba), [#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275))
- Fixed **GC root mishandling bug** in memprof.c that could cause memory corruption ([#14287](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14287))
- Improved **error handling during domain spawn** fixing potential memory leaks and deadlocks when rare errors occur during domain creation ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410))
- Enhanced **module signature pretty-printing** to preserve `(mod)` and other escaped infix keyword operators in `-dsource` output ([#14279](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14279))
- Updated **C interface manual** with documentation for the new thread registration API and domain lookup functions
latest_week.activity_summary: Discussion of hashing changes, pipe operator typing, and Haiku native backend ongoing
latest_week.activity:
- [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) opened discussion about **switching Hashtbl to seeded by default** unless `OCAMLRUNPARAM=r` is set, proposing change from current deterministic behavior ([#14291](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14291)) and separately about **deprecating Digest top-level MD5 bindings** in favor of Blake128 now that internal compiler use switched to Blake128 ([#14290](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14290), relates to merged [#13913](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13913))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) proposed **pipe operator type-checking change** to typecheck `x |> f y` as `(f y x)` instead of `((f y) x)` for better compatibility with OxCaml variant ([#14286](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14286))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) merged **5.4.0 release preparation** including highlights document, changelog synchronization, and calendar updates ([#14284](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14284))
- [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) updated **multicoretests compatibility** to version 0.11 to match Domain.spawn error message changes ([#14285](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14285))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) continuing work on **relocatable OCaml implementation** with PRs for search/suffix handling and relative libdir configuration ([#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) progressing on **Merlin typing recovery integration** for better IDE error handling ([#14241](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14241))
- [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) working on **Haiku native backend activation** to bring OCaml native compilation support to Haiku OS ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing **string splitting functions** `cut_on_char` and `rcut_on_char` for String/Bytes/StringLabels modules ([#14068](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14068))
- [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) proposing **application let-operator** `( let@ )` syntax addition ([#13698](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13698))
- [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) working on making **`-init` flag work with `-e` option** in toplevel ([#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190))
- Long-running **LoongArch architecture support** PR continues with community interest ([#11974](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/11974))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Feature discussions around Blake128 migration, seeded hash tables, and type system enhancements
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- Discussion about **migrating from MD5 to Blake128** for user-facing Digest module APIs after internal compiler migration completed, with consideration of deprecation strategy and ecosystem impact ([#14290](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14290))
- Proposal to **change default Hashtbl behavior to seeded** (non-deterministic) unless explicitly disabled, requiring investigation of compiler dependency on deterministic hashing and potential opam package breakage ([#14291](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14291))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) raising **pipe operator typing behavior** for compatibility between upstream OCaml and OxCaml variant, with implications for code portability ([#14286](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14286))
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) opened discussion about **snapshot test fragility** when standard library line numbers change, seeking solutions for more robust testing ([#14289](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14289))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on runtime safety, cross-platform support, and hash algorithm modernization
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime system safety improvements** with multiple merged fixes for domain creation error handling, thread registration, and GC root management showing continued focus on multicore stability ([#12410](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12410), [#14287](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14287), [#14275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14275))
- **Migration away from MD5** continuing with Blake128 now used internally in compiler and discussion of deprecating user-facing MD5 APIs in Digest module ([#13913](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13913), [#14290](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14290))
- **Cross-platform expansion efforts** including Haiku native backend work and long-running LoongArch architecture support demonstrating broader hardware support goals ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138), [#11974](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/11974))
- **Security-conscious defaults discussion** with proposals for seeded hash tables by default and consideration of attack resistance versus determinism trade-offs ([#14291](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14291))
- **OCaml variant compatibility work** with OxCaml-inspired changes like pipe operator typing being proposed for upstream integration ([#14286](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14286))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New Thread.set_current_thread_name function for setting thread names on supported platforms
oldest_week.new_features:
- New **Thread.set_current_thread_name** function allows setting thread names from within thread functions, available on most systems that support the functionality ([#13504](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13504))
- **Documentation improvements** for `-safe-string` option clarification in Bytes module interface explaining immutability invariant protection ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **GC verbose flag documentation** reformatted with cleaner hexadecimal notation (0x001 instead of 0x0001) in Gc.control interface ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **String.to_seq documentation** enhanced to clarify behavior in "unsafe-string" mode where modifications during iteration are reflected in sequence ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Core compiler maintenance with runtime events, typing improvements, and documentation updates
oldest_week.activity:
- **Runtime events enhancement** by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with addition of `Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR` event for better garbage collection monitoring ([#13407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13407))
- **Memory documentation improvement** by [@andyhhp](https://github.com/andyhhp) adding discussion of `CAMLnoreturn` attribute usage in memory.h header ([#13561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13561))
- **Local module type substitution fix** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) addressing issue [#13388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13388) where local substitution could fail ([#13540](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13540))
- **Manual clarification** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) disambiguating the `-with-runtime` option documentation ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))
- **Testsuite cleanup** by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions for better js_of_ocaml compatibility ([#13550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13550))
- **Ongoing modular explicits development** with [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continuing work on [#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275), a feature for module-parametrized functions enabling convenient abstraction over higher-kinded types

oldest_week.contributors:

latest_week.brief_summary: Bug fixes for depext exit codes and pin-depends handling, git submodule checks, and API improvements for repository root handling
latest_week.new_features_summary: Fixed depext-only exit codes, pin-depends on simulated pins, git submodule status checks, and made default-invariant modifiable
latest_week.new_features:
- Fixed **exit code behavior** for `opam install --depext-only` which previously returned 0 on package conflicts instead of proper error code 20 by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6516](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6516), fixes [#6488](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6488))
- Fixed **pin-depends handling** in simulated pins where dependencies specified in pin-depends field were being ignored during `opam install --deps-only` operations by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6611](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6611), fixes [#6610](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6610))
- Added **git submodule status checking** to prevent opam from incorrectly treating repositories as up-to-date when submodules are outdated by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6153](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6153))
- Made **global `default-invariant` option modifiable** through `opam option` command, previously unchangeable after initialization by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6730](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6730), fixes [#6724](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6724))
- Improved **error messages for extra-files** to display filenames instead of full paths and handle invalid extra-file names with early failures rather than silent ignoring by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) and [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6679](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6679))
- Added **`OPAMAUTOANSWER` environment variable** for internal testing use to automate interactive prompts with named question labels by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6709](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6709))
latest_week.activity_summary: Repository format refactoring, test improvements, environment script fixes, and new feature proposals for npm-like workflow and repo show command
latest_week.activity:
- **Repository root API abstraction** work ongoing by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to prepare for storing HTTP repositories as tar.gz files instead of unpacking, aiming to eliminate multi-minute untarring operations ([#6680](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6680), extracted from [#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6625))
- **Test infrastructure improvements** with new `sed-hash` command for reftests to simplify hash and path replacement in test outputs by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) ([#6734](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6734)), git configuration hardening for hermetic tests by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#6728](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6728)), macOS GHA runner compatibility fixes ([#6719](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6719)), and OCaml 5.4 test matrix addition ([#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6732))
- **Environment script idempotency fix** proposed by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) preventing `variables.sh` from being sourced multiple times when `OPAM_SWITCH_PREFIX` already set, addressing years of reports about broken paths in subshells and VS Code terminals ([#6729](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6729), fixes [#4649](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4649), [#6633](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6633))
- **`opam repo show` command** implementation by [Francisco Santos](https://github.com/ProgramingIsTheFuture) adding ability to display URL and rank of specific repositories with `--all` switch support ([#6720](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6720), related to [#6235](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6235))
- **AppArmor support** for installation script ready for merge by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#6647](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6647), fixes [#5968](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5968))
- **Depext status checking** during `opam update` proposed by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) to reload available system packages and improve performance ([#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489), fixes [#6461](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6461), [#4172](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4172))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Design discussions on npm-like workflows, compiler version ranges, inplace pins, and multi-platform lock file improvements
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **npm-like workflow support** discussed by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) proposing `opam add`/`rm` commands for automatic dependency management, `opam ci` equivalent to `opam install --lock`, and project-driven workflow improvements ([#6726](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6726), related to [#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725), [#6588](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6588))
- **Parallel depext loading** proposed to speed up `opam update` by running system package detection commands in parallel with repository updates once [#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489) merges, requiring domains support ([#6727](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6727))
- **Inplace pins** proposed to avoid costly copies for local packages in monorepos by treating pins under local switch directory as symlinks and building in-place ([#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725))
- **Simplified compiler version ranges** discussed with proposals for `opam switch create 5.3` to accept patch versions via formula syntax or wildcard patterns like `5.3.*` ([#6589](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6589))
- **Best-effort multi-platform lock files** proposed to preserve platform-specific disjunctions until `opam lock` runs on each platform, improving cross-platform workflow similar to uv ([#6587](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6587))
- **Transitive pin-depends** debate continued with [Alexander Shopov](https://github.com/shonfeder) favoring recursive behavior where explicit pins override transitively derived pins to address repeated user confusion ([#4003](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4003))
- **Package variant selection** issue reported by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) where unpinning `ocaml-variants.5.4.0+trunk` unexpectedly downgraded to `5.3.0+BER` instead of latest stable ([#6731](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6731))
- **macOS and nix-darwin testing** proposed to verify depext support for Nix on macOS and nix-darwin full OS support ([#6723](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6723))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on performance optimization through HTTP repository format changes, test infrastructure hardening, and workflow improvements for modern developer expectations
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Performance optimization** through repository format changes with [#6625](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6625) aiming to eliminate 1+ minute untarring delays on HTTP repository updates by storing tar.gz files directly, and [#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489) proposing parallel depext loading during updates ([#6727](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6727))
- **Modern workflow ergonomics** with npm-inspired commands ([#6726](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6726)), improved lock file multi-platform support ([#6587](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6587)), and inplace pin optimization for monorepos ([#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725)) addressing user expectations from other package managers
- **Test infrastructure maturity** with hermetic git configuration ([#6728](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6728)), reftest utilities like `sed-hash` ([#6734](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6734)), comprehensive pin-depends test coverage ([#6611](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6611)), and OCaml 5.4 compatibility testing ([#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6732))
- **API modernization** continuing with repository root abstractions ([#6680](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6680)) removing assumptions about directory-based repositories to enable future tar.gz storage format
latest_week.contributors_summary: Kate and R. Boujbel drove most merged work with bug fixes and API improvements, David Allsopp contributed environment script fixes, Francisco Santos added repo show command
latest_week.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) merged fixes for pin-depends handling ([#6611](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6611)), git submodule status checking ([#6153](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6153)), OPAMAUTOANSWER environment variable ([#6709](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6709)), macOS test compatibility ([#6719](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6719)), and repository API abstractions ([#6679](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6679)), plus opened design issues for npm-like workflows ([#6726](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6726)), inplace pins ([#6725](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6725)), parallel depext loading ([#6727](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6727)), and macOS depext testing ([#6723](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6723))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) merged depext-only exit code fix ([#6516](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6516)), default-invariant modifiable option ([#6730](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6730)), reftest sed-hash command ([#6734](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6734)), and collaborated on repository API work ([#6679](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6679)) with comprehensive test additions
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) proposed environment script idempotency fix ([#6729](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6729)) and git configuration hardening for hermetic tests ([#6728](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6728))
- [Francisco Santos](https://github.com/ProgramingIsTheFuture) implemented `opam repo show` command with switch filtering ([#6720](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6720))
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) continued work on depext status checking during updates ([#6489](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6489))
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) reported package variant selection issue during unpin ([#6731](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6731))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1 with bug fixes, improved Windows support, and enhanced release infrastructure
oldest_week.new_features_summary: First beta release of opam 2.3.0 with bug fixes and platform improvements across Linux, Windows, macOS, FreeBSD and OpenBSD
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1** with comprehensive bug fixes and platform support improvements ([2.3.0-beta1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/releases/tag/2.3.0-beta1))
- Fixed **VCS pinning regression** that stored untracked files in local VCS directories, resolving git submodule issues ([#6221](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6221))
- Fixed **platform compatibility** crash on OpenBSD where `getconf LONG_BIT` is unavailable ([#6230](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6230))
- Fixed **package cache corruption** storing wrong opam file versions after build failures ([#6213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6213))
- Fixed **lint regression** W59 with local URLs that aren't archives ([#6219](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6219))
- **Enhanced Windows support** with fixes for OCaml 5.0+ compilation ([#6216](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6216))
- **Improved release infrastructure** including RISC-V Linux binary support and FreeBSD 14.1/OpenBSD 7.6 upgrades ([c7a1d9fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/c7a1d9fc0605f907ada31e165779995273dd5477), [7a78925110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/7a78925110e0a6e005fc2c087d2fd0c7edf79a1a))
- **Updated install scripts** with 2.3.0~beta1 binary checksums for all supported platforms ([b600f1e88](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b600f1e88f779db90fd2f57e911b749449e510f4))
- **New documentation CI job** added to GitHub Actions for automated doc generation and validation ([f48edffd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/f48edffd118e8e50e8211a199c559c77162e1318))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Week focused on release preparation and infrastructure improvements with team coordination between Kate and R. Boujbel
oldest_week.activity:

latest_week.brief_summary: Bug reports for code lenses and symbol ranges in v1.23.0, discussion on LSP support for alternative build systems
latest_week.activity_summary: Two bug reports filed against v1.23.0 and ongoing dependency update PR
latest_week.activity:
- Bug report filed by [Correnson Loïc](https://github.com/correnson) about **code lenses cluttering** internal let-bindings in v1.23.0, requesting VSCode setting to disable ([#1561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1561))
- **Symbol range error** reported by [Correnson Loïc](https://github.com/correnson) causing `textDocument/documentSymbol` failures in v1.23.0 with `selectionRange must be contained in fullRange` validation error ([#1560](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1560))
- Automated **Nix flake.lock update** PR by [@github-actions](https://github.com/github-actions) updating merlin5_3 and nixpkgs dependencies to 2025-10-06 versions ([#1437](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1437))
- Ongoing PR by [David Sancho](https://github.com/davesnx) adding **ocamlformat-mlx support** for `.mlx` files to enable formatting outside of dune, addressing dialect formatting needs ([#1528](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1528))
- Discussion update from [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) about `--fallback-read-dot-merlin` default behavior, with [Benjamin Mordaunt](https://github.com/gr1mpatr0n) suggesting `--prefer-dot-merlin` naming alternative ([#1522](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1522))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Discussion on LSP integration with alternative build systems like Buck2
latest_week.notable_discussions: - [Benjamin Mordaunt](https://github.com/gr1mpatr0n) initiated discussion on **LSP support outside Dune ecosystem**, specifically for Buck2 build system integration, raising concerns about LSP requiring `dune build` activation and questioning abstractions for alternative build systems to provide artifact location information ([#1562](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/discussions/1562))
latest_week.trends_summary: Two v1.23.0 regression reports suggest quality issues with recent release
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Quality concerns** with v1.23.0 release evident from two separate bug reports by [Correnson Loïc](https://github.com/correnson) regarding code lenses behavior changes and symbol range validation errors not present in v1.22.0 ([#1561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1561), [#1560](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1560))
- **Build system diversity** discussion highlighting demand for LSP support beyond Dune-centric workflows, particularly for organizations using Buck2 and similar tools ([#1562](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/discussions/1562))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Issue reporting by Correnson Loïc, discussion participation from Benjamin Mordaunt and Kate
latest_week.contributors:

- [Benjamin Mordaunt](https://github.com/gr1mpatr0n) initiated discussion on LSP integration with Buck2 build system and commented on `.merlin` fallback flag naming in [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)'s issue ([#1562](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/discussions/1562), [#1522](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1522))

latest_week.brief_summary: Cram test conflict detection, package management improvements, and OxCaml parameterized libraries support
latest_week.new_features_summary: Cram conflict detection, dune tools env command, package dependency reuse, and parameterized library support
latest_week.new_features:
- **Cram test conflict marker detection** added via new `(conflict error|ignore)` option in cram stanza, failing tests when conflict markers are present ([#12538](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12538))
- **`dune tools env` command** to add dev tools to PATH for easier editor integration and terminal workflows ([#12521](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12521))
- **Package dependency reuse** between project and dev tools, preventing unnecessary rebuilding of shared dependencies through package digest-based directory structure ([#12526](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12526))
- **OxCaml parameterized library support** via new `(parameters ...)` field in library stanza, enabling library parameterization with `-parameter` compiler flag ([#12336](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12336))
- **Merlin config generation for library parameters** ensuring proper IDE support for OxCaml parameterized libraries ([#12550](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12550))
- **`dune install --create-install-files` fix** to overwrite read-only opam files, addressing build failures from read-only promoted files ([#12542](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12542))
- **Package build isolation** from project settings to prevent unnecessary compiler rebuilds when changing dune-project version ([#12556](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12556))
- **Duplicate repository name validation** in workspace files to prevent configuration errors ([#12548](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12548))
- **Lint check for changelog entries** ensuring new changes use structured format instead of `.md` files in `doc/changes` ([#12553](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12553))
- **Automatic changelog generation script** from structured `doc/changes` directories supporting release workflow automation ([#12516](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12516))
- **OCaml 5.4 CI support** updating workflows for latest compiler release ([#12552](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12552))
- **Documentation CSS improvements** preventing inline code from wrapping across lines in HTML output ([#12541](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12541))
- **Documentation variable reference improvements** clarifying `ocaml-config:v` expansion behavior ([#12539](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12539))
- **Melange ocamldep rules cleanup** removing unnecessary file copying operations ([#12532](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12532))
- **Single-module ocamldep optimization** skipping transitive dependency computation for buildables with only one module ([#12555](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12555))
- **Melange module cycle test** adding test coverage for cycle detection ([#12554](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12554))

latest_week.brief_summary: One RFC proposal withdrawn following community feedback on syntactic sugar design tradeoffs
latest_week.activity_summary: Discussion and closure of for-in syntax proposal, ongoing tuple projections RFC review
latest_week.activity:
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) withdrew the **`for...in` syntax** RFC proposal following community feedback about syntactic sugar design tradeoffs and OCaml's functional programming idioms ([#56](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/56))
- Ongoing **tuple projections** RFC by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) proposing labeled and unlabeled tuple field access syntax like `x.tuple` and `x.3` ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/57))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Debate on syntactic sugar justification comparing for-in loops with higher-order functions
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- Discussion in [#56](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/56) centered on **syntactic sugar justification thresholds**, with [@Makefile-dot-in](https://github.com/Makefile-dot-in) arguing that OCaml's equivalence between `(fun x -> e) y` and `let y = x in e` eliminates the need for special for-each syntax unlike other languages where control flow complicates this equivalence
- Comparison drawn between the **readability gains of let-operators** for monads/applicatives versus the more modest improvements offered by for-in syntax over existing `ListLabels.iter ~f:(fun x -> ...)` patterns
latest_week.contributors_summary: Two contributors engaged in RFC discussions around language syntax proposals
latest_week.contributors:
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) authored and withdrew the for-in syntax RFC after community discussion ([#56](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/56))
- [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) continues developing the tuple projections RFC with ongoing refinements ([#57](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/57))
- [@Makefile-dot-in](https://github.com/Makefile-dot-in) provided detailed review comments on syntactic sugar design principles and language semantics comparisons ([#56](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/56))

latest_week.brief_summary: Discussion activity on two open issues involving functor assertion errors and code block hiding in .mld files
latest_week.discussions_summary: Technical investigation and debugging of functor-related internal errors, plus feature request for hidden code blocks
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- [Dorian Lesbre](https://github.com/dlesbre) provided detailed debugging investigation on **functor assertion failure** ([#960](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/960)), creating a minimal reproducible example that isolates the issue to a name confusion between a directory `f` and functor `F` when using `include_subdirs qualified`, with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) acknowledging the investigation and promising to review when available
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) received feedback on **hiding code blocks in `.mld` files** ([#1331](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1331)) with another user requesting this feature for hiding MDX setup code like `#require` and `#install_printer` directives that aren't suitable for MDX preludes
latest_week.contributors_summary: Dorian Lesbre provided extensive debugging work, Daniel Bünzli received feedback on feature request, Jon Ludlam acknowledged issue
latest_week.contributors:
- [Dorian Lesbre](https://github.com/dlesbre) conducted detailed technical investigation of the `assert_not_functor` internal error ([#960](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/960)), creating a minimal reproducible example and providing detailed analysis of the functor name confusion issue with `include_subdirs qualified`
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) responded to [#960](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/960) acknowledging the investigation and indicating he will review the issue when time permits
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) received feedback on the feature request for hiding code blocks in `.mld` files ([#1331](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1331))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Planning phase for odoc 3.0 improvements with new issues for package infrastructure and driver enhancement PRs
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Added gitignore entries for odoc driver output directories to improve developer experience
oldest_week.new_features: - Enhanced **developer workflow** by adding gitignore entries for `_odoc` and `_html` directories generated by odoc driver ([#1218](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1218))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Three major PRs opened for index pages, sidebar overhaul, and frontmatter syntax plus active design discussions
oldest_week.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** including index pages improvement by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), sidebar and index overhaul by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220)), and frontmatter syntax implementation ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Index page improvements** delivered through driver-generated package pages with library and module listings, addressing need for better navigation when handmade index pages don't exist ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Sidebar architecture** completely redesigned with unified tree representations across page, document, and unit sidebars, implementing smart content filtering that shows current page, ancestors, and siblings while avoiding overwhelming displays ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- **Frontmatter syntax** development progressing with sexp-based approach for metadata like children order, short titles, and opens, though shifting toward existing `@-tags` syntax following [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)'s recommendations ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Planning phase** launched for odoc 3.0 infrastructure with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) creating multiple issues covering opam metadata dependencies ([#1216](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1216)), markdown input support ([#1213](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1213)), deep sidebar JSON output ([#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1214)), and driver compilation phases separation ([#1215](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1215))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Detailed technical discussions on index page patterns, sexp syntax vs @-tags, and sidebar navigation design
oldest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Index page patterns** discussed by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) regarding automatically generated vs handmade pages, with emphasis on using section headings and `{!modules}` directives for better navigation ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Syntax design debate** between sexp-based frontmatter and existing `@-tags` approach, with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) advocating for consistency with existing ocamldoc language rather than importing new serialization formats ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Sidebar behavior** examined by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) focusing on predictability and efficient use of horizontal space, suggesting separation of global content from unit-specific indexes ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on improving user experience through better navigation, standardizing metadata syntax, and planning infrastructure upgrades
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Navigation enhancement** priority with multiple parallel efforts on index pages, sidebar redesign, and hierarchical content organization aimed at making large documentation sets more accessible
- **Syntax standardization** movement toward leveraging existing ocamldoc `@-tags` rather than introducing new formats, emphasizing consistency with established language conventions
- **Infrastructure preparation** for odoc 3.0 with comprehensive planning covering opam integration, driver architecture, and compilation workflow improvements
oldest_week.issues_summary: Sublist indentation improvement identified as markdown compatibility enhancement opportunity
oldest_week.good_first_issues: - **Markdown compatibility** improvement needed for sublist indentation behavior to match standard markdown rendering, making nested lists display properly instead of flattening ([#1219](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1219))
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Five contributors active with planning, PR submissions, and design discussions across navigation and syntax improvements
oldest_week.contributors:

- [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) contributed gitignore improvements ([#1218](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1218)), implemented index pages enhancement ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), developed frontmatter syntax ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210)), and identified sublist indentation issue ([#1219](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1219))
- [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) architected comprehensive sidebar overhaul unifying tree representations and implementing smart content filtering ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) provided detailed design feedback on index page patterns ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), advocated for `@-tags` syntax approach ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210)), and reviewed sidebar navigation design ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))

latest_week.activity_summary: Five new PRs opened for packages (otp, p5scm, doi2bib) plus extensive OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem updates and dependency fixes
latest_week.activity:
- Five **new PRs opened** this week awaiting review: time-based OTP implementation by [A.G.](https://github.com/Heyji2) ([#28704](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28704)), Scheme via camlp5 by [Jason D. Nielsen](https://github.com/drjdn) ([#28700](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28700)), doi2bib with deduplication refactoring by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) ([#28703](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28703)), raylib 5.5 upgrade by [Tobias Mock](https://github.com/tjammer) with Windows msys issues ([#28680](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28680)), and lwt 6.0.0 beta by [Raphaël Proust](https://github.com/raphael-proust) with lower-bounds failures ([#28558](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28558))
- **Ten new packages** introduced: mlsolver 1.5 and fadecider 0.7 migrated from OASIS to DUNE and OCaml 5 by [Oliver Friedmann](https://github.com/oliverfriedmann) ([#28701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28701), [#28702](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28702)), pcrc 0.25.2 parameterized CRC implementations by [Anton Yabchinskiy](https://github.com/a12n) ([#28699](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28699)), oenv composable environment variable reader versions 0.0.1 and 0.1.0 by [Satoru Kawahara](https://github.com/Nymphium) ([#28674](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28674), [#28698](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28698)), vsrocq-language-server 2.3.1 LSP server by [@vscoqbot](https://github.com/vscoqbot) ([#28691](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28691)), spoke 0.0.4 SPAKE+EE with mirage-crypto.1.0.0 by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) ([#28640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28640)), incremental_cycles 0.1 by [Armaël Guéneau](https://github.com/Armael) ([#28563](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28563)), synchronizer 0.1 by [@redianthus](https://github.com/redianthus) ([#28642](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28642)), mosaique 0.0.1 libvips bindings by [@Naora](https://github.com/Naora) ([#28632](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28632)), and coq-waterproof 3.0.0+8.19 mathematical proofs by [@jim-portegies](https://github.com/jim-portegies) ([#28499](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28499))
- **Jane Street packages** updated to v0.17.1 by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) including hardcaml, ppx_derive_at_runtime, ppx_hardcaml, ppx_jsonaf_conv, ppx_pattern_bind, ppx_quick_test, ppx_typed_fields, streamable ([#28681](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28681)), and ppx_js_style/ppx_yojson_conv with ppxlib constraints ([#28673](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28673))
- **MirageOS ecosystem** updates by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) including mirage 4.10.2 with cmdliner 2.0.0 upgrade ([#28645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28645)), mirage-net-xen 2.1.7 reading MTU from xenstore ([#28684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28684)), and chamelon 0.2.1 littlefs subset by [yomimono](https://github.com/yomimono) ([#28682](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28682))
- **Infrastructure tools** updated including dockerfile 8.3.2 eDSL packages by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) ([#28694](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28694)), dunolint 0.0.20251006 build file linter by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) ([#28658](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28658)), notty-community 0.2.4 terminal library by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) ([#28688](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28688)), and fstar 2025.10.06 with ppxlib workaround by [Guido Martínez](https://github.com/mtzguido) ([#28661](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28661))
- **Testing packages** multicoretests 0.10 including qcheck-lin, qcheck-multicoretests-util, qcheck-stm by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28664](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28664))
- **Dependency fixes** including yojson upper bound for morbig.0.11.0 due to removed Tuple/Variant types by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([#28695](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28695)), base v0.15.1 patch moved to opam-source-archives for checksum stability by [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) ([#28676](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28676)), cmdliner 2.0.0 constraints for mrmime.0.5.0 ([#28689](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28689)), diffast-git-cli ([#28671](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28671)), ocamlformat-mlx ([#28668](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28668)), and sherlodoc ([#28656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28656)) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) and [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri), dune upper bound for tezt 3.1.0-4.2.0 tests due to Sys.argv.(0) changes ([#28550](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28550)), conf-npm added to alcotest-js.1.9.1 ([#28669](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28669)), z3.4.15.2 macOS build parallelization by [Alexander Bantyev](https://github.com/balsoft) ([#28678](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28678)), and macOS CI accept-failures for pyparsing and tomli not available via homebrew by [Tiago Ferreira](https://github.com/tiferrei) ([#28666](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28666), [#28670](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28670))
- **Extensive diffast release** v0.3.5.1 by [@codinuum](https://github.com/codinuum) covering 41 packages across multiple programming languages including C++, Fortran, Java, Python, and Verilog support with vlt.0.2.5 marked conflicting with ppxlib.0.37.0~5.4preview ([#28652](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28652))
latest_week.discussions_summary: OCaml 5.4.0 readiness tracking, cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility challenges, and GitHub patch URL instability
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **OCaml 5.4.0 release readiness** tracked extensively in [#27916](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27916) with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) coordinating platform tools including dune, merlin, lsp-server, odoc, ocamlformat, ppxlib, mdx, utop, and infrastructure components, with [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin) noting many packages now available in kit-ty-kate/opam-alpha-repository
- **cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility** discussed across multiple PRs with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) adding upper bounds for older packages and removing constraints for updated ones, highlighting ecosystem-wide breaking changes requiring careful coordination ([#28689](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28689), [#28671](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28671), [#28668](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28668), [#28656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28656), [#28654](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28654), [#28645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28645))
- **GitHub patch URL instability** addressed in [#28675](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28675) when base v0.15.1 patch checksum changed, with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) explaining process to download from opam cache and upload to opam-source-archives, demonstrating fragility of external patch dependencies and resolved by [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) in [#28676](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28676)
- **ppxlib version stability** discussed with [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri) marking ppxlib 0.36.0 and 0.36.1 as avoid-version in [#28663](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28663) due to pretty-printing bug fixes causing test suite differences, and [François Pottier](https://github.com/fpottier) identifying ppxlib version matters more than OCaml version for visitors compatibility in [#28692](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28692)
- **conf-package lower bounds** discussed in [#28541](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28541) with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) noting conf-gmp, conf-llvm, conf-libclang failures, and [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) questioning whether x-maintenance-intent should be added since only latest versions may be relevant
- **CI linting in publication tools** discussed in [#26959](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26959) with [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) tracking PRs to dune-release and opam-publish to enable pre-submission linting using opam-ci-check, with [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) confirming PRs need merging
latest_week.trends_summary: Ecosystem-wide OCaml 5.4.0 adoption, cmdliner 2.0.0 migration challenges, and improved package archiving practices
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **OCaml 5.4.0 ecosystem adoption** accelerating with compiler release accompanied by immediate updates to core platform tools (ppxlib, camlp5, camlp4, mdx, visitors) and infrastructure (ocaml-version, dockerfile), demonstrating coordinated release management across the ecosystem ([#28683](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28683), [#28686](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28686), [#28667](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28667), [#28677](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28677), [#28659](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28659), [#28690](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28690), [#27916](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/27916))
- **Build system modernization** continuing with packages migrating from OASIS to Dune and OCaml 4 to OCaml 5, seen in mlsolver 1.5 and fadecider 0.7 releases, reflecting broader ecosystem shift toward modern tooling ([#28701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28701), [#28702](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28702))
- **cmdliner 2.0.0 breaking changes** causing widespread compatibility work with maintainers adding upper bounds to older packages while newer releases adopt the updated API, highlighting challenges of managing breaking changes across the ecosystem ([#28689](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28689), [#28671](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28671), [#28668](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28668), [#28656](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28656), [#28645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28645))
- **Package archiving reliability** improving with recognition of GitHub patch URL instability leading to migration to opam-source-archives for stable checksums, establishing more robust archiving practices ([#28675](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28675), [#28676](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28676))
- **ppxlib stability focus** with avoid-version markings for releases with subtle breaking changes in pretty-printing behavior affecting test suites, demonstrating increased attention to downstream compatibility ([#28663](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28663), [#28692](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28692))
- **Jane Street ecosystem updates** continuing with v0.17.1 releases coordinated across multiple ppx packages demonstrating ongoing maintenance and OCaml 5.x compatibility work ([#28681](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28681), [#28673](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28673), [#28679](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28679))
- **MirageOS development** continuing with updates to core components including cmdliner 2.0.0 migration, xenstore MTU reading, and littlefs filesystem work ([#28645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28645), [#28684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28684), [#28682](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28682))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New package releases for YOCaml static site generator, opam 2.3.0 beta, ActivityPub implementation, and Rust integration tools
oldest_week.new_features:
- **YOCaml static site generator** version 2.0.1 released with 12 comprehensive packages including markdown, YAML, Git integration, and multiple templating engines ([8965be0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/8965be0448d2eb507add00fc3c1b0c52ab4bcb60))
- **opam 2.3.0 beta1** released with 8 updated packages providing early access to new package manager features ([01638e0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/01638e0884c6a8cafdcd39d6e21c947902d08b81))
- **ActivityPub protocol implementation** suite released with 5 packages for decentralized social networking including client, server, and GUI components ([eeae27e](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/eeae27e7ee82ef2fed40c3e8c2024791991ef516))
- **Rust staticlib integration** tools released with multiple versions (0.1.0 and 0.2.0) for OCaml-Rust interoperability ([6f456bd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/6f456bd754cfd8673752ba70897a2c33cceb278a))
- **HOL Light theorem prover** version 3.0.0 with fixed installation paths and source copying improvements ([86fa229](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/86fa2296e6c8132b1e29abac6a6f2e5d2cc075ef))
- **OpenAPI code generation** tools version 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 for OCaml with Opium web framework integration ([2dea405](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/2dea405ff1bb436553291fc47a3e52c0f42fd4d7))
- **CATT proof assistant** version 1.0 for working with higher-dimensional categories ([c877086](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/c877086b779f63da9d23134f867a19a24a895154))
- **Mirage unikernel** framework updated to version 4.8.1 with runtime improvements ([9aea193](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/9aea19340d871dbbc99952df8feb97ccab3f4d2f))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Repository maintenance focused on package submissions and bug report handling with 4 issues closed during the week
oldest_week.activity:
- **Package ecosystem expansion** with 63 new package files added spanning diverse domains from static site generation to theorem proving and web frameworks
- **Issue resolution** including [#26701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26701) lablgl OCaml 5.2 compatibility closed by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette), [#26749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26749) gitlab.inria.fr availability issue resolved by [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers), and compiler installation problems [#26706](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26706) and [#26686](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26686) closed with community support guidance
- **Infrastructure resilience** demonstrated through quick resolution of external dependency issues affecting package installations
- **Compiler compatibility** discussions ongoing with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) addressing toplevel path configuration issues in [#25819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/25819) and [Tahina Ramananandro (professional account)](https://github.com/tahina-pro) reporting Cygwin python3 configuration challenges in [#26434](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26434)
oldest_week.trends_summary: Strong focus on ecosystem expansion with web frameworks, static site generators, and cross-language integration tools
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Static site generation** gaining momentum with comprehensive YOCaml 2.0.1 release featuring modern tooling and multiple template engine support
- **Cross-language integration** advancing with new Rust staticlib generation tools enabling OCaml-Rust interoperability
- **Web framework development** progressing with OpenAPI code generation tools and ActivityPub protocol implementations
- **Package manager evolution** continuing with opam 2.3.0 beta1 introducing next-generation features
- **Theorem proving ecosystem** expanding with HOL Light 3.0.0 and CATT 1.0 releases
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Community contributors submitted numerous packages while maintainers handled issue resolution and provided user support
oldest_week.contributors:
- [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) reported lablgl OCaml 5.2 compatibility issues and participated in package installation troubleshooting discussions ([#26701](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26701))
- [Mark Elvers](https://github.com/mtelvers) identified and reported critical gitlab.inria.fr infrastructure issues affecting package installations ([#26749](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26749))
- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) continued advocacy for toplevel path configuration improvements with technical analysis of OCAML_TOPLEVEL_PATH vs OCAMLTOP_INCLUDE_PATH ([#25819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/25819))
- [Tahina Ramananandro (professional account)](https://github.com/tahina-pro) documented complex Cygwin Python configuration challenges affecting Windows OCaml development ([#26434](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/26434))
- Repository maintainers provided community support by directing users to appropriate forums and closing resolved issues with helpful guidance

latest_week.brief_summary: Windows CRLF handling improvements and bug investigation for variable escaping issue
latest_week.new_features_summary: Improved Windows line ending support by removing CRLF workarounds and adding binary mode handling
latest_week.new_features:
- Removed **CRLF workarounds** in GitHub Actions workflows for Windows builds, eliminating forced LF conversion that was only needed for OCaml < 5.2 ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2087))
- Added **binary mode output** to `gen_dune.ml` test generator to ensure consistent line ending handling across platforms ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
- Enhanced **JavaScript parser** to handle `\r` (carriage return) as whitespace in token processing ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
- Updated **multiline string tests** to normalize CRLF to LF for consistent parsing validation ([eaea1a1](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/eaea1a102f339911f9bf867a5d0b9f1ce53f1ec4))
latest_week.activity_summary: Bug investigation for variable escaping in release builds and ongoing OCaml 5.4 support work
latest_week.activity:
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) **opened bug report** for variable escaping assertion failure in release builds with `--linkall` flag, traced to tail-modulo-cons and closure duplication issues potentially related to previous closure optimization work ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) **investigating** the variable escaping bug with suspicion that live variable tracking is not properly updated when duplicating closures, requesting review from [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) **opened PR** to add `Intl.RelativeTimeFormat` JavaScript API bindings for internationalized relative time formatting, awaiting review ([#2070](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2070))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) **continuing work** on OCaml 5.4 support testing in draft PR ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2103))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) **reported** issue with Node.js module references appearing in browser-targeted builds when using dev profile, which doesn't occur with release profile ([#1809](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1809))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on cross-platform compatibility and build system improvements for Windows support
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform support** receiving attention with removal of legacy CRLF workarounds as OCaml 5.2+ provides better native handling ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2087))
- **Build system modernization** through elimination of platform-specific git configuration hacks in CI workflows ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2087))
- **Compiler optimization bugs** surfacing with complex feature interactions like tail-modulo-cons, closure duplication, and linkall flags requiring careful investigation ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Hugo Heuzard merged Windows CRLF fixes, Nicolás Ojeda Bär reported and investigated variable escaping bug
latest_week.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) **merged** Windows line ending improvements removing CRLF workarounds and updating parser handling ([#2087](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2087)), **investigating** variable escaping bug in closure duplication ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106)), and **working on** OCaml 5.4 support ([#2103](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2103))
- [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) **reported** variable escaping assertion failure with detailed reproduction case and debug logs, **traced** the issue to tail-modulo-cons and linkall interactions ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) **contributed** Intl.RelativeTimeFormat API bindings for internationalization support ([#2070](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/2070))
- [Rizo](https://github.com/rizo) **reported** Node.js module reference issue in browser builds with dev profile ([#1809](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1809))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) **requested for review** on variable escaping bug related to closure optimization work ([#2106](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2106))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Major architecture change removing wasm backend, improved sourcemap index support, and modernized runtime features
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend** (~32,000 lines of WASM-related code deleted), transforming the project back to pure JavaScript compilation ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Enhanced sourcemap support** with index mapping for linking multiple JS files together, improving debugging capabilities ([1e54c94](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1e54c943918016553ed2ba6cf75abe29596b8833), [a0a03bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a0a03bd67ecdf83a86350b9e5b391ceb39c9cf72), [6f38333](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6f38333b2e704a615afd7dca0aab101f68052f73))
- **Modern JavaScript runtime optimization** using static `Object.hasOwn` instead of dynamic property checks for better performance ([1bc3ab8](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1bc3ab8cde58915a35b4f2af59fae9c27f8dc392))
- **Improved weak reference handling** with complete runtime reimplementation for better memory management ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Global dead code elimination regression tests** added to prevent future issues ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067), [ebc6c4c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ebc6c4c00ccfede2fff6890e2f9c81b8b91bf5a8))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization
oldest_week.activity:
- **Complete architectural transformation** removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Documentation rewrite** completely updating README from wasm_of_ocaml focus to comprehensive js_of_ocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Runtime system modernization** across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Build system cleanup** removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Major simplification trend moving from dual JS/WASM targets to single JavaScript focus
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend consolidation strategy** with the project moving away from dual compilation targets (JavaScript + WebAssembly) to focus exclusively on JavaScript compilation, simplifying maintenance and development efforts
- **Modern JavaScript adoption** with runtime optimizations using current browser APIs like `Object.hasOwn` for improved performance and compatibility
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through improved sourcemap handling, particularly for complex linking scenarios involving multiple JavaScript files
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Limited activity with one feature request by Jérôme Vouillon and ongoing experimental work by hhugo
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opened feature request [#1719](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1719) for auditing and modernizing Dom_html module, focusing on updating mouse event properties from int to float and removing outdated Internet Explorer compatibility code
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) continues experimental work on monomorphic representation for MlBytes in [#1229](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1229), an ongoing draft PR from 2022 focused on runtime performance optimizations using deoptigate analysis

latest_week.brief_summary: Runtime quotations and js_of_ocaml integration landed alongside DWARF debugging improvements and block indices moving to stable
latest_week.new_features_summary: Runtime metaprogramming with quotations, full js_of_ocaml integration, block indices stable, DWARF debugging improvements
latest_week.new_features:
- **Runtime quotations and metaprogramming** system with new `<[` `]>` quotation syntax and `$` splicing operator for runtime code generation and evaluation, including stage tracking in the type system and AST representation in CamlInternalQuote module by [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian), [Jack Rickard](https://github.com/Skepfyr), and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395), [#4852](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4852), [#4864](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4864), [#4874](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4874), [#4855](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4855), [#4856](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4856))
- **Full js_of_ocaml compiler** integration imported into oxcaml with JSIR mode for JavaScript compilation and complete backend support by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) and [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) ([#4730](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4730), [#4737](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4737), [#4739](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4739), [#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743))
- **Block indices moved to stable** production-ready status with new `%unsafe_get_ptr` and `%unsafe_set_ptr` primitives, improved flattened float field handling with unboxed types, and safety constraint disallowing block indices to `[@atomic]` fields by [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) and [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([#4827](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4827), [#4824](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4824), [#4826](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4826), [#4828](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4828))
- **CFG terminator simplification** improves compilation of for loops by eliminating redundant jumps through rewriting unconditional jumps to conditional jumps, saving one comparison in simple loops by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4772](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4772))
- **Lambda layout specialization** enhancement uses externality information to avoid unnecessary `caml_modify` calls in specialized code through more precise GC-ignorability analysis by [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) and [Ryan Tjoa](https://github.com/rtjoa) ([#4853](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4853))
- **Polymorphic variants with-bounds** restored with performance fixes addressing pathological fuel algorithm cases and early termination optimization for mode-crossing by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([#4847](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4847))
- **New `-gdwarf-may-alter-codegen-experimental` flag** enables experimental DWARF debugging features by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4871](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4871))
- **Backend parameterization** refactoring enables adding new backends without code duplication through optcomp parameterization on backend implementation and asmlink split into three files by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4825](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4825), [#4838](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4838))
- Fixed **allocation site information** for inlined closures to correct debuginfo showing in OCaml backtraces and Memtrace by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#4842](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4842), fixes [#4831](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4831))
- Fixed **Multicore.spawn soundness** issue by requiring resource argument to be `contended` and annotating as `once` for flexibility by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#4875](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4875))
- Fixed **jkind normalization** soundness bug with modalities by tracking modalities when skipping previously seen types by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#4777](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4777))
- Fixed **over-expunged toplevel** by removing Float_u, Iarray, IarrayLabels, Int32_u, Int64_u, Nativeint_u from toplevel as these aren't in compatible Stdlib, spotted during ICFP tutorial by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) ([#4877](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4877))
- Fixed **zero_alloc warning scope** so top-level `[@@@warning "-199"]` works correctly by saving scope where attribute is encountered by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4819](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4819))
- Fixed **atomic fields in mixed blocks** miscompilation by rejecting unsupported cases where atomic fields get wrong field index by [Aspen Smith](https://github.com/glittershark) ([#4868](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4868))
- Fixed **bytecode differentiation** between Bytes.get and String.get needed by js_of_ocaml for different representations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#4782](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4782))
- Fixed **spill placement** with Name_for_debugger to ensure spilled registers inherit debug names correctly by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#4837](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4837))
- Fixed **ocaml-probes usability** by emitting dummy probe notes when `[%probe_is_enabled name]` appears without corresponding `[%probe name]` to avoid linking errors by [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4834](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4834))
- **Register availability analysis** improvements with multiple bug fixes in DWARF tracking for better debug information generation by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4835](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4835), [#4870](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4870))
- **Mode system refactoring** simplifies adding new mode axes with net code reduction (252 additions, 501 deletions) by [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) ([#4790](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4790))
- **CI performance improvements** including faster ocamlformat workflow saving ~15 seconds per job with setup-ocaml optimization and reduced macOS CI load by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4857](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4857), [#4858](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4858), [#4859](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4859))
- **AGENTS.md documentation** moves Claude instructions to separate file for better organization of AI-assisted development by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#4849](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4849))
- **JSIR documentation** added covering JavaScript IR quirks by [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) ([#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743))
- **DWARF test filtering** with README and identifier number filtering for stable diffs by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4829))
- **Type path printing** improvement penalizes hash types in error messages so users see `f64` instead of `float#` by [Nailen Matschke](https://github.com/nmatschke) ([#4832](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4832))

latest_week.discussions_summary: For loop optimization discussion, runtime quotations extensive review, register availability analysis details, backend parameterization design
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- For loop optimization **approaches debated** in [#4752](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4752) with [Akshat](https://github.com/Auth0x78) proposing lambda simplification approach while [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/Gbury) noted simplif happens before inlining, related to implementation PRs by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4772](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4772), [#4807](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4807))
- **Wrong allocation site information** for inlined closures reported by [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan) in [#4831](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4831) about missing inlined frames affecting OCaml backtraces and Memtrace accuracy, fixed by [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) ([#4842](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4842))
- **Runtime quotations** extensive review of [#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395) with 65+ comments from [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) and [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) discussing stage tracking, type system integration, GADT support, and uniqueness analysis across 9,312 additions in 72 files
- **Register availability analysis** detailed technical review of [#4835](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4835) with 25+ comments from [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) addressing Unreachable handling, register comparisons, machtype comparisons, and debug info concerns
- **Backend parameterization** design discussions in [#4825](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4825) about interface design for modular backends enabling js_of_ocaml integration
- **Polymorphic variants performance** concerns in [#4847](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4847) about fuel algorithm with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) approval requesting monitoring to avoid repeating June performance issues
latest_week.trends_summary: Metaprogramming infrastructure build-out, JavaScript backend maturation, DWARF debugging excellence, type system evolution, CI modernization
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Metaprogramming infrastructure** build-out with runtime quotations introducing `<[` `]>` syntax and `$` splicing, ocaml-jit integration for JIT compilation, stage tracking in type system, and foundation for staged computation ([#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395), [#4852](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4852), [#4864](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4864), [#4874](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4874), [#4855](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4855), [#4856](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4856))
- **JavaScript backend maturation** with full js_of_ocaml integration importing 300K+ lines of code, JSIR mode development, and making ocamlj a fully-featured compiler ([#4730](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4730), [#4737](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4737), [#4739](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4739), [#4743](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4743), [#4791](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4791), [#4753](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4753))
- **DWARF debugging excellence** through continuous improvements to debugging experience including register availability analysis refinement, better debuginfo for inlined code, experimental flags for testing new features, with consistent collaboration between [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) and [Greta Yorsh](https://github.com/gretay-js) ([#4835](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4835), [#4870](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4870), [#4871](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4871), [#4872](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4872), [#4837](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4837), [#4863](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4863), [#4842](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4842), [#4834](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4834), [#4829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4829))
- **Type system evolution** with unboxed types moving to production through block indices stabilization, mode system refactoring for extensibility, jkind normalization fixes, and modality tracking improvements ([#4827](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4827), [#4824](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4824), [#4826](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4826), [#4828](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4828), [#4790](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4790), [#4777](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4777))
- **CI and build infrastructure modernization** through setup-ocaml adoption, speed optimizations saving 15+ seconds per job, Nix flake integration, and automated diff promotion workflows ([#4857](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4857), [#4858](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4858), [#4859](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4859), [#4711](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4711), [#4810](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4810))
- **Backend modularity** refactoring for parameterized backends, splitting monolithic files like asmlink into three files, and preparing for multiple target architectures ([#4825](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4825), [#4838](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4838))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Repository restructuring with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime and flambda improvements

oldest_week.activity_summary: Major repository restructuring completed with backend directory moved to asmcomp, plus runtime issues addressed
oldest_week.activity:
- **Repository restructuring** completed by moving entire `backend/` directory structure to `asmcomp/` location, affecting hundreds of files including compiler internals, architecture-specific code, and debugging infrastructure
- **Runtime compatibility** addressed with [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) reporting OCAMLRUNPARAM=v=4096 flag overloading issue where custom timestamp behavior conflicts with upstream OCaml 5.1 changes ([#3158](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3158))
